page.title: 02LONDON INN.
page.content: The London Inn is in the centre of Summercourt. It is a very old building and is about 200 years old, stone built with a slate roof. The outside has recently been whitened and the inn sign decorated. It sells beer and bar food and is open seven days a week. The present landlords are Mr and Mrs Gill who have been there about 1 year and are tenants of the St Austell brewery.A new kitchen has been built and a family room provided.The grounds around the pub are well cared for and a beer garden section has been grassed in the last year. This now has 3 wooden benches on it in the shade of some sycamore trees.The pub is well decorated with flower boxes and hanging baskets and has a car park at the rear.
